comment: Spent a week in Reno NV. All-encompasing "all you can eat" at the El Dorado. Great indy foodie & culture & cocktail scene outside of the casino district.
Dinosaur BBQ in Gowanus
High grocery spending due to hosting a birthday dinner. The theme of the party was Caligugaga (A Caligula & Lady Gaga themed party). What was served? Was it the chili?
I only have vaugue memories from this month. I spent some time in Bay Ridge for the Sidewalk Art Walk installation and have a foggy memory of some middle eastern take-out after installing my art.
Sat outside practially in the parking lot and enjoyed chilaquiles at Anepalco Mexican Restaurant in Santa Ana CA.
Nachos at a Cyclones baseball game in Coney Island.
No insight into why I spent so little on groceries this month. Fletchers BBQ after helping friend pack for a move. We were tired
column3: dirty and sweaty and the meal tasted better after our effort.

comment: Incredible Dandan noodle soup on a Brooklyn backyard patio on a hot summer evening.
Inventive vegan sushi at Beyond Sushi on 14t Street with an out of town friend.
Dinner with out of town vegan friends at the Pickle Hut on 4th Avenue.
Epic friendsgiving on second floor of my building. Giant friendly crowd and

Pricey Mexican at a tequila bar on Smith Street. I nursed one $15 margarita and watched in horror as date got wasted drinking four back to back. I was worried the whole time we'd have to split the bill. In the end he paid.
Spend the month at an artist residency in Nebraska. Ate incredible bbq at Ladybug BBQ and met a chef who cooked me meals from the Pok Pok cookbook.
Got a gift certificate at Enoteca on Court Street at a work holiday party. Spent it with two close friends easting thin crust pizza.
Made taco dinner with kimchi and other asian flavors for my birthday. Just a few close pals.
Lots of dates this month. Earl Gray ice cream cone from Van H. Costco shopping?
Picke up tacos from Tacos el Bronco and ate them Sunset Park with friends from out of town. Got an coconut ice treat from a vendor.
Friend graduated from nursing school. Big celebration dinner in backyard with cocktails served in urine specimine cups.
Wonderful 4th of July celebration on Park Slope roof. Great salads.
Pulled pork sandwiches at Ice House in Red Hook. Rehearsal dinner for friend's wedding at German venue in Catskills.
Went on lots of dates this month.
Date cooked me a vegan roast thing with side of kale at date's house. The meal was delicious but made me very uncomfortably gassy. The apartment was too small to relieve myself discretely.
Steiner Studios party? Free drinks and food. (is this right)
Low grocery spending due to trip to Toronto for Christmas.
Ate brunch at the vast banquet-hall Dim Sum Seafood Palace in Brooklyn with pals.
An incredibly delicious burger at Prime Meats on Court Street after a friend helped install a projection screen to the ceiling.
birthday. dinner with Toronto friend Thai pop-up in Red Hook.
Sri Lankan on Staten Island.
Brooklyn backyard cookout (?)
Lumen festival on Staten Island...mac & cheese from a food truck.
Northhampton long weekend. Wine and cheese on the porch. Pie shop in town.
Low spending month.
Melasian food at Redang Island in Sunset Park followed by wandering through the neighborhood with slushies & bubble tea.
Sausages and sourcraut at Octoberfest hosted by SolarOne.
Hosted a turkeyless thanksgiving.
Went on a date to a Sunset Park meat on sticks restaurant. Date ordered daring things.
Mouth-on-fire chicken wings at a romantic dimly lit Korean restaurant in Greenpoint. It was a memorable date.
It's the 02/17 comment
High spending due to a Southern California trip and 40th birthday party.
It's the 04/17 comment
It's the 05/17 comment
It's the 06/17 comment
Rita's slushy on the boardwalk at Coney Island. High grocery bill because I paid for groceries for trips upsate and friend paid for car and bus fare.
Why so low? In upstate NY walked to the nearby farm to get meat and eggs. Free herbs and lettuce from the garden.
It's the 09/17 comment
Gourmet meal in New Canaan after visiting Philip Johnson's GlassHouse. Tasty but not filling. We got Dunkin Donoughts after.
Habachi in Lake George NY. This was my first time so I was surprised and delighted by the theatrics of it. Sake being squirted into our mouths by the chef.
Ugly Baby Thai on Smith Street with some pals. So hot but so tasty. insanely long wait for Indian in DC.
Sneak in liquorish allsorts from Sahadi's into a movie.
Southwest road trip
Gelato from Eatily and Thai Larb in the East Village for my birthday.
Lunches in the Flatiron District. Overpriced salads. Green Juice from a street vendor
Lunches in the Flatiron District. Overpriced salads. Turns out I really love Arby's. Green Juice from a street vendor
Spent a lot of time living in an airstream Camper. Spent a lot on groceries.
Foraging for chanterelles in upstate New York.
Road trip in New Mexico. Red & Green chile and honey-drizled sapodillas. Ate terrible pie in Pueblo.
Hagen Daz ice cream on sale.
Celebrating a friend's birthday at Plant Love House.
"Incredible Chinese Fusion po-boys & beignets in New Orleans. Frozen Banana Colada at a dive bar."
Hipster Cambodian meal at Tuk Tuk Canteen on Roncesvalles in Toronto. Japanese street food in Kensington Market. Nachos at Sneeky Dee's.
